title: How to deal with being suddenly single
text:

When you have been in a relationship for a long time, it’s easy to forget what it’s like being single. You are so used to doing things together, being part of a couple, that it feels like you have lost a limb when you suddenly break-up. However, as gutting as it is to be alone, it is possible to spring back with these healing strategies.Don’t push yourself to socialise and date before you are ready. Allow yourself to grieve for your lost love; get used to doing things on your own and start enjoying your own company. Rushing into another relationship or into the dating pool may be counter-productive.Don’t get pressurised into talking about your ex with friends and family if it disturbs you. People will be curious about why you broke up but you do not owe an explanation to anybody. Feel free to tell them that you do not want to talk about him.Help yourself achieve closure by removing all reminders of him. Dispose all old photos, mementos, clothing, gifts…you have no use for them anymore. The most important thing, however, is to curtail all social media contact. Block him everywhere and control your urge to cyber stalk him!You are now the centre of your universe and you better make the most of it! Learn to put yourself first; introspect to figure what you want and work on getting there. Since you no longer have to bother about what anyone else is thinking, live the way you desire and air your opinions freely!Being in a relationship often forces us to change and become lesser versions of ourselves. So use this window of opportunity to develop yourself. Cultivate new hobbies, make new friends, explore the world, and if you do decide to date again, use what you have learnt from past failures to avoid making the same mistakes again.
description: It’s not easy being single after you have been in a relationship for a long time. Here are ways to deal if you are suddenly on your own
